sentences.english: There has always been one major caveat, however, to the research on the fade-out effect.
sentences.chinese: 但是消退效應有一個致命的軟肋。

sentences.english: Jinshan conscious weakness found old adversary, joy in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 金山自覺發現了老對頭的軟肋，心中欣喜。

sentences.english: But that expansionary zeal may turn out to be the firm’s Achilles’ heel.
sentences.chinese: 但是那種膨脹性的熱誠或許會成爲這家公司的軟肋。

sentences.english: Once they sense an employee's soft spot, they pounce on it.
sentences.chinese: 他們嗅到員工的軟肋，就會重拳出擊。

sentences.english: The street talk a lane to smell a virago conjecture in the soft rib ache beauty lightly crumple.
sentences.chinese: 街談巷聞潑婦虛擬中，軟肋疼痛紅顏輕輕揉。

sentences.english: Yet China’s economy still has weaknesses.
sentences.chinese: 然而中國經濟仍然存在軟肋。

sentences.english: Tyra, a teetotaler, said food is her only vice.
sentences.chinese: 泰拉是一個禁酒主義者，她說食物是她唯一的軟肋。

definition: to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
to fall short of/to have a deficit/deficit/deficiency
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
